holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: Celebration of the first day of the Gregorian calendar year.

holidays.name: Martin Luther King Jr. Day
holidays.description: Honors the life and achievements of Martin Luther King Jr. (Third Monday in January).

holidays.name: Presidents' Day
holidays.description: Celebrates all U.S. presidents, especially George Washington and Abraham Lincoln.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday
holidays.description: Christian holiday celebrating the resurrection of Jesus Christ. Date varies each year.

holidays.name: Memorial Day
holidays.description: Remembers and honors military personnel who died in service. Last Monday in May.

holidays.name: Independence Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the Declaration of Independence in 1776.

holidays.name: Labor Day
holidays.description: Honors the contributions of American workers. First Monday in September.

holidays.name: Columbus Day
holidays.description: Commemorates Christopher Columbus's landing in the Americas. Second Monday in October.

holidays.name: Veterans Day
holidays.description: Honors military veterans who served in the United States Armed Forces.

holidays.name: Thanksgiving Day
holidays.description: Day of gratitude and feasting, traditionally celebrating the fall harvest. Fourth Thursday in November.

holidays.name: Christmas Day
holidays.description: Celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ; widely observed as a cultural holiday.
